title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 07 June 2016 - XWiki
content:
<ansuz> has joined #xwiki  
07:24 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:30 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:00 <amack2> has joined #xwiki  
08:02 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
08:33 <amack2> I can't get the document tree rendered with the documentTree macro. It only displays "#documentTree($options)" in the view. Any hints?  
08:34 <vmassol> hi amack2  
08:34 <amack2> hi vmassol  
08:34 <vmassol> if you're using xwiki syntax you should use {{documentTree}}  
08:34 <vmassol> see examples on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Document+Tree+Macro  
08:34 <vmassol> actually  
08:34 <vmassol> you're right  
08:35 <vmassol> seems marius also contributed a velocity macro :)  
08:35 <vmassol> (just readi it ;))  
08:35 <vmassol> but normally you should use the wiki macro  
08:35 <amack2> I'm using this: {{documentTree root="document:xwiki:Sandbox.WebHome" checkboxes="true"/}}  
08:35 <vmassol> so this will show children  
08:35 <vmassol> but you don't have any ;)  
08:36 <vmassol> (my guess)  
08:36 <vmassol> the Sandbox app by default doesn't have any nested pages  
08:36 <vmassol> hmmm  
08:36 <vmassol> actually it should work I think  
08:36 <vmassol> let me try  
08:37 <amack2> I can do it anywhere and it just does renders "#documentTree($options)" in the outpzut  
08:37 <vmassol> ah no that shoud;n't be  
08:37 <vmassol> you're using it wrongly  
08:37 <vmassol> if you use #documentTree  
08:37 <vmassol> do you use {{ or # ?  
08:38 <vmassol> if you use {{documentTree… then it shouldn't display #documentTree normally  
08:38 <vmassol> I have to go now but I hope marius or someone else here can help you  
08:38 <vmassol> I'll be back in 1 hour  
08:39 <amack2> ok  
08:39 <vmassol> FTR I don't understand either why {{documentTree root="document:xwiki:Sandbox.WebHome"/}} doesn't work  
08:39 <vmassol> for me it just shows an empty tree  
08:39 <vmassol> as you can see on http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/VMA/  
08:40 <amack2> yes, that's what I expect  
08:41 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:52 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:11 <Evi\_> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <Evi\_> hi, I have deleted a page, but it is still there in the tree. Can anyone help me?  
09:19 <Evi\_> Ah the problem is solved, there was a children page, which I had to delete first  
09:21 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <Evi\_> has quit  
09:26 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
09:38 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:49 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <amack2> playground dow not have the Document Tree Macro XAR installed  
10:08 <amack2> but the document tree in AllDocs is working  
10:10 <amack2> mflorea: I have a problem with documentTree: it's only rendered as "#documentTree($options)", not the contents  
10:10 <amack2> any hints?  
10:22 <mflorea> amack2: I've updated http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Document+Tree+Macro#HUsage let me know if it works for you. Btw, why don't you use the wiki macro instead of the Velocity macro?  
10:22 <amack2> mflorea: I do use the wiki macro, it just renders to this sequence  
10:23 <mflorea> can you paste the line with the call to the wiki macro?  
10:24 <amack2>    
10:24 <amack2> {{documentTree /}}  
10:24 <amack2> renders to: Org3  
10:24 <amack2>    
10:24 <amack2> ##documentTree($options) #  
10:25 <mflorea> what XWiki version are you using?  
10:26 <amack2> 7.4.2  
10:28 <amack2> hmm it looks like the class from Document Tree s missingi  
10:31 <amack2> can I reinstall Document Tree Macros?  
10:32 <mflorea> the DocumentTree page is not a class, I'm not sure what you mean  
10:32 <amack2> no, I mean the whole xar  
10:33 <mflorea> you don't have the XWiki.DocumentTree page?  
10:34 <mflorea> you said the tree from the page index is fine  
10:34 <mflorea> I'm pretty sure you have the XWiki.DocumentTree page  
10:34 <mflorea> otherwise you would get "Unknown macro: documentTree"  
10:35 <mflorea> #documentTree($options) comes from the {{documentTree}} macro's code which is in the XWiki.DocumentTree page  
10:37 <amack2> I do have the XWiki.DocumentTree page, but on this page, the WikiMacroClass 0: Document Tree is missing  
10:37 <amack2> (the macro itself)  
10:39 <amack2> ok, I reinstalled the extension  
10:39 <lkrejci> has quit  
10:39 <mflorea> that's strange, because if the WikiMacroClass object is missing then the {{documentTree}} macro should not be found, and as I said, you would get "Unknown macro: documentTree"  
10:39 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
10:40 <mflorea> do you have the XWiki.WikiMacroParameterClass objects on the XWiki.DocumentTree page?  
10:40 <amack2> no, I didn'T  
10:40 <vmassol> amack2: check the history of this page  
10:40 <amack2> but after re-installing, it workd  
10:40 <vmassol> (with minor edits)  
10:40 <vmassol> to see what happened to it  
10:41 <vmassol> and why you don't have the full thing  
10:41 <vmassol> maybe some users deleted some stuff?  
10:41 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:43 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:50 <scristalli> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <scristalli> Good morning. I'm configuring XWiki for my installation. I want many wikis, with access permissions regulated by LDAP groups. I found that the rules which manage the right that wins in a tie (in case two rights are granted at the same time, for instance if a user belongs to more than one group) are fixed, defined in this file https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-security/xwiki-platfo  
10:55 <scristalli> I need a little different configuration, that's why I will recompile the appropriate module after modifying lines 126-146. I think that in general XWiki could benefit from putting such configuration in a separate file, so that it can be modified during installation without recompiling.  
10:56 <scristalli> What do you think? Is it best practice to open an "idea" type of issue on JIRA straight away or do I need some other approval first?  
10:56 <scristalli> Thank you.  
10:57 <evalica> of course you can submit an idea issue. You can also attach a patch to it. The discussions will come if your use case needs to be integrated by default, verifying that the use case is important  
10:57 <evalica> the discussions we usually have them on the mailinglists, since it's async  
11:00 <vmassol> scristalli: you can also submit your use case as a discussion on the list  
11:00 <vmassol> (users list, see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/MailingLists )  
11:01 <scristalli> Thanks. I will first complete the edit for my purpose, then submit the use case to the list and/or JIRA  
11:01 <vmassol> ok great!  
11:04 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <evalica> has quit

13:46 <lkrejci> has quit  
13:46 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
13:48 <vmassol> mflorea: hi  
13:49 <vmassol> I didn't follow the discussion of this morning re documentTree but would you know why http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/VMA/ doesn't work: {{documentTree root="document:xwiki:Sandbox.WebHome"/}} ?  
14:03 <evalica1> is now known as <evalica>  
14:04 <amack2> vmassol: I had to re-import the Document Tree xar  
14:07 <vmassol> amack2: sure but I'm talking about playground.xwiki.org here  
14:07 <vmassol> I don't understand why it doesn't work  
14:08 <vmassol> ie why we don't see for example http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Sandbox/TestPage1  
14:32 <mflorea> vmassol: http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/VMA/?viewer=changes&rev1=4.1&rev2=5.1  
14:33 <vmassol> grrr  
14:33 <vmassol> thanks  
14:33 <mflorea> there's no Sandbox on the main wiki http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Sandbox/  
14:34 <vmassol> yup  
14:34 <vmassol> sorry  
14:34 <mflorea> np  
14:46 <fitz\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:49 <fitz> has quit  
14:52 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
15:02 <msmeria> has quit  
15:04 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
15:29 <vmassol> evalica: btw do we have a proposal/vote for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13478 ?  
15:29 <vmassol> (I don't remember)  
15:30 <vmassol> it seems like a major change to me that would require one (if not already done)  
15:30 <evalica> vmassol: the discussion is not finished, that's why I did a PR. I would like to have the code in a PR, so I can move to other things (while the discussion is ongoing)  
15:31 <vmassol> so there's a thread?  
15:31 <evalica> to be honest I would like to see more activity on the topic  
15:31 <evalica> yes - but not a vote  
15:31 <vmassol> I dont remember the thread  
15:31 <vmassol> can you point me to it so that I can reply?  
15:31 <evalica> http://markmail.org/thread/3z7fdjxtmwkwkav3  
15:31 <vmassol> thx  
15:35 <acotiuga> has quit  
15:38 <lkrejci> has quit  
15:38 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
15:47 <scristalli> has quit  
15:58 <vmassol> @evalica actually I 've answered that thread!  
15:58 <vmassol> but it seems lots of my comments were just disregarded and not taken into account :)  
15:59 <vmassol> including the video issue  
15:59 <evalica> where is your answeR?  
15:59 <vmassol> there are several but here's one: http://markmail.org/message/nqzkxfefty32qmjw where I mentioned the video issue  
16:00 <vmassol> so the question is:  
16:00 <vmassol> if the user is not connected to the internet, does it still look good?  
16:00 <vmassol> I wouldn't agree that xwiki requires internet connectivity for its home page  
16:00 <vmassol> checking (going to disconnect from here ;))  
16:03 <vmassol> has quit  
16:03 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
16:04 <vmassol> back  
16:04 <vmassol> it looks a bit strange; the dinosaur looks a bit like WTF ;)  
16:04 <vmassol> https://www.evernote.com/l/AHdt3ziua\_ZJK7rmxfSQ7Gp1PTG9TR7B3ZM  
16:04 <vmassol> when you hover you get the message "The Internet connection has been lost."  
16:05 <evalica> vmassol: the dinosaur is browser specific :P  
16:05 <vmassol> I know  
16:05 <vmassol> I also don't like the fact that the markup is a bit weird, I'll comment  
16:06 <evalica> k - ty
